quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to select the name of the student whose id is equal to 23.
[!raw!]
SELECT id, name 
FROM students 
{0} id={1}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The WHERE Statement[/h1]

The [b]WHERE [/b]clause is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified criterion.

The syntax for the WHERE clause: [code format="sql" ]SELECT column_list 
FROM table_name
[b]WHERE [/b]condition;[/code]
Consider the following table: [img id="2796" width="100%"]
In the above table, to SELECT a specific record: [code format="sql" ]SELECT * FROM customers
[b]WHERE ID = 7;[/b][/code] 
[img id="2804" width="100%"]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blank to select student names whose id is greater than or equal to 12.
[!raw!]
SELECT id, name 
FROM students WHERE id {0} 12;
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]SQL Operators[/h1]

[b]Comparison Operators [/b]and [b]Logical Operators[/b] are used in the WHERE clause to filter the data to be selected.

The following comparison operators can be used in the WHERE clause: [img id="2805" width="100%"]
For example, we can display all customers names listed in our table, with the exception of the one with ID 5.[code format="sql" ]SELECT * FROM customers
[b]WHERE ID != 5;[/b][/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2806" width="100%"]
[note]As you can see, the record with ID=5 is excluded from the list.[/note]

quizzes.question:
Build a query to select the names of students whose ids are between 13 and 45.
[!raw!]
SELECT id, name
{0} students 
{1} id 
{2} {3} AND 45;
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The BETWEEN Operator[/h1]

The BETWEEN operator selects values within a range. The first value must be lower bound and the second value, the upper bound.

The syntax for the BETWEEN clause is as follows: [code format="sql"]SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name [b]BETWEEN [/b]value1 [b]AND [/b]value2;[/code]
The following SQL statement selects all records with IDs that fall between 3 and 7:[code format="sql"]SELECT * FROM customers 
WHERE ID [b]BETWEEN [/b]3 [b]AND [/b]7;[/code]
[b]Result[/b]: [img id="2807" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to select all values from the ''people'' table where the city equals to ''Boston''.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Text Values[/h1]

When working with text columns, surround any text that appears in the statement with[b] single quotation marks (')[/b].

The following SQL statement selects all records in which the  [i]City [/i]is equal to 'New York'.[code format="sql"]SELECT ID, FirstName, LastName, City 
FROM customers
WHERE City = [b]'New York'[/b];[/code] 
[img id="2808" width="100%"]
